Cyril. Then we must certainly

Vivian. Briefly then they are these. Art
never expresses anything but itself.
It has an independent life, just
as Thought has, and develops purely
on its own lines. It is not necessarily
realistic in an age of realism,
nor spiritual in an age of faith.
So far from being the creation of
its time, it is usually in direct
opposition it to it, and the only
history that it preserves for us
is the history of its own progress.
